inn1.comm: back of a length and Panyangara explores the channel outside off, Hafeez shoulders arms
pitched further up, the line is outside off again. Left alone calmly
good length and just a shade outside off, Hafeez presses forward to defend it

sharp running between the wickets. Hafeez gets off the mark with a dab-and-run single in front of the covers. The fielder sprints in, swoops down on the ball, under-arm lobbing it onto the strikers' but Azhar was in
down the track, gets a very full ball, mishits a drive towards mid-on
tight line outside off, teases Azhar. He does not bite.
good length and angling away outside off, Hafeez shows restraint as he shoulders arms
much fuller and slanting away with the angle outside off. Hafeez tips forward and lets it pass to the keeper
back of a length and angled away outside off, Hafeez rides the extra bounce and dabs it past backward point with soft-ish hands
back of a length and on middle, Azhar hangs back and clips it neatly to the right of mid-on for a couple
length on off, he shuffles across off, shimmies down the track, opens up the leg side and whips it away through midwicket
extra zip on bounce on this shortish ball, angled away outside off. Azhar lets it be
fuller and outside off, pressed in front of the covers for another quick single
good length and outside off, Azhar seeks to drive it away. He ends up jabbing it towards mid-off with firm hands
on a length and outside off, draws Azhar into a forward-defensive push to the covers
back of a length and outside off with some bounce, dabbed into the covers. Hit high on the bat
back of a length again, this one nips back in. Azhar has a lazy push and manages an inside edge onto the thigh pad
fuller length and on off, he gets forward, drives well but finds mid-on
good length on a fourth-stump line, Hafeez presses forward and knocks it in front of short cover
pitched up and angling away outside off, Hafeez lunges forward and drives it to extra-cover
much fuller and outside off, Hafeez hunts for a drive and mis-times it back to the bowler
back of a length, straighter in line. Tucked out to midwicket
full ball attacking off, Hafeez gets forward and pushes this back to the bowler
maiden from Vitori! Good length and angled away outside off, Hafeez lets it be
on a length and just outside off, he nips down the track and punchily drives it past short cover. But mid-off moves to his left and has it covered
back of a length on off, he leans across and turns it to midwicket
fullish and tight line - just outside off. Patted into the covers
back of a length, accompanied by some away movement outside off. Poked out to gully
good length, homing in on off. He gets forward and presses it to the covers
back of a length and just outside off, defended towards cover-point. Make it 11 successive dots played out by the Professor
full on middle and leg, Azhar leans across and flicks it feebly to mid-on
fullish and on off, Azhar picks it from there and flicks it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Good placement earns him three
pitched up and outside off, Hafeez leans into a drive and directs it to mid-off. Breaks the sequence of dots
impressive placement again, brings the first four for Pakistan. Width on offer, slanting away, he comes forward and punches it in the gap at the covers
length and outside off, steered away to deep third man
good length and angling away, blocked solidly to the covers
Azhar steps out, Panyangara is wary of it as he drags his length back. Blunted in front of the covers
back of a length and comes in, worked to the leg side
heave ho! Slower length ball outside off, Azhar advances down the track, shimmies across and slogs it away in front of square on the leg side
length on off, driven straight to mid-on
short and hurries on off as the bowler shortens his length. Azhar ventures down the track, adjusts a bit, jabbing it towards mid-on
good length and outside off, guided to backward point
pitched up and outside off, Hafeez flows forward and drives it to mid-off
and again! Hafeez lunges forward, drives sweetly but can't beat mid-off
speedy single, Azhar reciprocated well. Hafeez checks his drive, chips it in front of mid-off. The fielder does not nail the stumps down
on a good length and angling away outside off, down the track is Azhar. He flashes and misses
good length and on off, pushed to the right of the bowler. He does not gather it cleanly, deflecting it towards mid-on. Azhar is halfway down for a single but is sent back
width on offer and Azhar latches onto it. Wide half-volley, he reaches out and slaps it away past the covers, skips away to the boundary
Has Hafeez rediscovered his mojo? On a length and outside off, he stands tall and lifts it over mid-on. One-bounce four
this is a six! Length on off, Hafeez goes across the line and slugs it over square leg for a flat blow
good length and just a shade outside off, stops on Hafeez, who waits on it and dabs it to off
fuller length and outside off, forward and driven to mid-off. There is a brief misfield but no harm done
change of pace outside off, tapped to point
mighty full at the base of off, not quite a yorker. Jammed out behind point
stray ball, sliding down leg. He can't glance it away. Wide called
down the track, Mpofu pulls his length back outside off. Azhar adjusts and cracks it away behind point
power followed by deft touch. good length with some away movement outside off. Change of pace. Azhar waits on it and glides it past the keeper, through the vacant slip cordon
full and straight, tucked to short midwicket
fuller and outside off, eased to point
pitched up on off, he aims to flick it to leg, gets a leading edge that pops in front of mid-off
length on off, Azhar Ali comes down the track and skies it over Vitori, who was backpedalling from mid-on. Azhar gets away with a couple
full on off, Hafeez flits down the track and drives it to long-off
full on off, now Azhar dances down the track and secures a single to long-off
flat and quick outside off, he leans back and executes a crisp cut past backward point. 50 up for the hosts
Hafeez comes down the track, Williams held this one back. Poked to the covers
slid through on off, Hafeez punches this to long-off off the back foot
length on off, Azhar hangs back and drives it to short cover
fuller and around off, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length and on off, guided to deep third man off the face of the bat
pitched up on off, Azhar walks across off and drills a drive back to the bowler, who bends low in his followthrough to stop the ball
dug in on a shortish length and outside off, he goes on the back foot and cuts it towards deep backward point
back of a length, outside off, sort of stops on the batsman. He checks his cut and chops it to off
fullish and on off, Hafeez now shuffles across and works it to midwicket
length on off, down the track and quietly blocked to covers
full and flat on middle, Azhar uses his feet and whippily drives it to long-on for one
round-armish on middle and leg, nudged behind square on the leg side
back of a length and on off, clipped to long-on
fuller and on middle and leg, he sinks to one knee and goes for a sweep, top-edges it over square leg
pushed through quicker, worked to the leg side
length and outside off, guided to third man
Azhar comes down the track, Mpofu sprays it down leg. Wide called
slippery short ball outside off. Looked like a slower bouncer. Azhar ponders over a pull before letting it pass
good length on off, dabbed to point with an open face
dug in on a shortish length and outside off, he leans back and late-cuts it to backward point. The fielder (Ervive) dives to his left and stops the ball
classy from Azhar. Full on off, he dances down the track, meets the pitch of the ball and flicks it between midwicket and mid-on
Mpofu dishes out a tripe short ball down leg, Azhar swivels and helps it over the man at 45 with a pull
clears long-on! On a length and on off, Hafeez runs down the track, gets into the act and hoists it over long-on
fuller and on middle and leg, helped behind square leg with a sweep
flatter and quicker outside off, punched past the covers
full on middle, down the track and pushed to the covers
flatter and spinning away outside off, Hafeez rocks back and cuts it strongly past point. Beats sweeper cover with ease
down the track again, Williams drags his length back. Dabbed to the off side
length and outside off, he does down on one knee and paddles it fine on the leg side
back of a length and on off, pushed to the covers
length on off, played back to the bowler
Azhar loads up for a reverse sweep. Utseya fires it down leg as the batsman belatedly pulls out of the shot. The keeper is beaten. Four byes
shortish and outside off, he punches and gets beaten on the outside edge
long-hop on off, Azhar rocks back and controls a pull to deep midwicket
full and outside off, he leans into the drive, diving save from Utseya at extra-cover
Vitori goes wide of the crease and angles this shortish ball outside off. Azhar Ali punches it between cover and point with an open face
back of a length on off, punched through the legs of Hafeez to mid-on
fired full and outside off, Azhar can't slice it away. Beaten
straighter in line, angled in, tucked out to midwicket

fifty for Azhar in his first home game. He raises his bat and acknowledges the cheers.. The crowd loving it. He loads into a drive and sends it to extra-cover, the fielder dives to his left. A fumble gives him a single
shortish and outside off, punched down to long-off
back of a length and outside off, Hafeez misses out the cut dab to third man
fuller length on off, pushed to the off side
back of a length and on off, he leans back and chops it to the covers
similar length and on off, punched to the off side
length and outside off, bunted down to long-off
length on middle, Hafeez charges down the track and drills it straight down the ground. He had umpire Tiffin doing the splits there. Hafeez is slowly catching up with his captain
shortish and on middle, milked to the right of midwicket
shortish and outside off with some extra bounce. Azhar hunts for the late dab to third man and misses
angled in on a back of a length, punched down to long-on
length and just outside off, pushed down to long-on
angled in around off on a short of a length, tucks up Ali for room. Played back to the bowler
length and outside off, cute reverse paddle to third man
dropped by Mpofu! Length on off, Azhar Ali nips down the track and skews it in the air off the bottom of the bat. Mishifts the lofted strike. Mpofu leaps at long-off but can only parry it away
eased down to long-on for one
straighter in line, worked to leg
full and outside off, down the track and drilled to long-off
he sinks to one knee and sweeps it away backward of square leg
Hafeez gets to a fifty of his own. Tossed up on middle, he top-edges a sweep wide of short fine leg. The ball spins further away from the fielder
tucked away off the hips behind square on the leg side
leg-stumpish ball, worked in front of midwicket
drifting down leg, Hafeez slips down to one knee and sweeps it away to the left of a diving short fine leg. Poor ball from Williams and it duly put away
straight roller on middle, pressed in front of the covers. Hafeez wants a quick single but Azhar sends him back
short ball on the leg stump, pulled away off the back foot to deep backward square leg
pitched up and outside off, he leans forward and laces a drive past the covers. B-e-a-u-t-i-f-u-l. Looked like an extension of a push but whistled away to the boundary
dropped shortish and outside off, Hafeez leans back and cuts it away behind point. Superb timing again
back of a length and on middle, turned to leg
fuller and straighter, clipped past midwicket
he goes low, takes it from outside off and sweeps it behind square on the leg side
length and outside off, wristy drive to long-off
full and outside off from round the stumps, driven to long-off
flat and quick on middle, gets some spin, chopped behind point for a single
fuller length on off, he manufactured that length by flitting down the track. Clobbered over wide long-on. Clean strike
flat and darted on off, he looks to force it away. Mistimes it to off
much shorter in length, mishit to leg
short and wide outside off, slapped straight to extra-cover
good length on off, driven to long-on
full on the stumps, down the track and drilled back to the bowler. Half stop
fuller and on off, pushed to the covers
down the track and eased to long-off
on a length and outside off, he steps out and drives to long-off
Hafeez pre-meditates a reverse-sweep and misses it. The bowler darted it down leg. The keeper takes it. Not too sure if there was a tickle on that...
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped away past midwicket to long-on
whacked over long-on! Length and outside off, he comes down the track and muscles it away
encore! He skips out, goes down one one knee and sends it soaring it over long-on. He has outpaced Ali
fired flat, he comes down the track and works it to leg
another darter, which is dabbed to leg
pushed through outside off, tapped to point
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, carved away wide of the covers. In front of square on the off side
length on off, down the track and punched to mid-off
drifting down leg, helped to long leg with a sweep
half-tracker outside off, Hafeez takes it from there and nails a pull to the deep midwicket boundary
on a length and on off and middle, swept away behind square leg

top edge and Panyangara takes it! Zimbabwe break the opening stand at long last.. On a length and outside off, with some extra bounce. Azhar slips to one knee and goes for a slog sweep. He does not middle it and skies it over backward square leg. Panyangara moved to his left and judged it pretty well
good length and around off, Malik inches forward and presses it to the covers
back of a length and cuts back in to strike Malik high on the thigh pad after he had missed the push
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, he eases forward and punchily drives it in the gap at the covers for three
on a good length and outside off, he checks his flick and chips it in front of midwicket
width on offer outside off, Hafeez camps back and flashes a cut to sweeper cover
pitched up and on a fourth-stump line. Forward and blocked to the covers

Bowled'em.. two in two for Utseya. This was a straight ball, Hafeez shuffles across, does not connect with the pre-meditated paddle. Utseya hits middle and leg. He is all smiles; Hafeez also misses out on a ton
on a back of a length and on middle and leg, tucked to the left of midwicket
darted on middle and leg, punched to long-on
back of a length and outside off, he leans back and punches it to the covers
picked away off the pads in front of square on the on side
length on middle, punched to long-on
sprays this one miles wide outside off. Haris does not bother with it
on a length and outside off, beats the groping bat of Haris
pitched up and outside off, Haris chases it with a loose drive and thick-edges it to deep third man
slower offbreak outside off with some extra bounce. Glided to deep third man
back of a length on middle and leg, milked in front of square for one
good length on off, tapped to mid-on, who dives forward and makes a good save
pitched up on off, eased to mid-on
length on middle, clipped to the left of mid-on
pushed wide outside off, Malik chases it with a cute dab to third man and is beaten
punched back at the bowler off the back foot
straight in line, eased down to long-on for one
tucked off the pads through midwicket
shortish and on off, Malik ventures deep in the crease as he whips it away to deep midwicket
angled on the pads from round the stumps, whipped to deep backward square leg
down the track, Raza pulls his length back. Punched to mid-off
flat and quick outside off, slapped to the covers
Haris uses his feet, nearly yorks himself and jabs a single to long-on
leg-stump ball, clipped away behind square on the leg side
Raza held this one back nicely, Haris takes a step out and check-pushes it back to the bowler
down the track and punched back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, tucked to mid-on
short and on the leg stump, pulled to deep backward square leg
darted short on middle, Haris backs away, makes room and smacks this one past the covers
nudged off the pads to the leg side
pushed back to the bowler
darted on a back of a length and outside off, cut away backward of point
back of a length and outside off, down the track and punched to long-off
straight on middle from round the stumps, worked to midwicket
shot! That raises 200 for the hosts. Full and on off, Malik gallops down the track, gets close to the pitch of the ball and hoists it over long-off
punched down to long-off for a single as this was on a length and on off
Haris now comes down the track, takes it on the full and bunts it to long-on
full and straight, whipped to long-on
full on off, Malik flows forward and drives it to long-off
skiddy ball on middle, blocked to leg side, in front of midwicket
beats mid-off to his left! Good length on middle, Harris dances down the track and lifts it for four. He did not larrup it, just timing and placement
Harris backs away and crunches a cut behind square on the off side. He hares back for the second
Malik takes this from outside off, whips his wrists and sends it to cow corner. The fielder from long-on dives to his right and hauls the ball in. Utseya finishes 10-0-63-2
dug in short, top-of-off line. Malik rocks back, makes room and cuts it firmly in front of square
fuller and on middle and leg, punched to midwicket. A fumble gives away one
low full toss down leg, he misses out. Paddling it straight to short fine leg
down the pitch and punched to long-off
tucked away through midwicket as this too was full and straight
looped up on middle, nudged to midwicket
slowy ball just outside off, pulls the pace off it. Pushed back to the bowler
looks another slower ball, shortish and outside off. He checks his cut and plays it to point. Fumble
run-a-ball fifty partnership..Fullish and outside off, pushed towards point
length and on off, nudged through midwicket for one
good length and outside off, he twirls his wrists and flicks it to the left of the bowler towards mid-on.
lifter outside off, Malik controls a pull to deep midwicket
good length, angled in, too straight in line. Glanced fine of short fine leg. Bad ball and easy four
back of a length and on off, flicked away behind square leg with some nifty wristwork. Fine leg can't cut that off
picked away from off stump to deep midwicket for a single
fraction short on middle and leg, forced to long-on
back of a length and outside off, flipped with the wrists wide of midwicket. He comes back for the second
bouncer from Panyangara, beats Malik on the pull
full and fired at the base of off, squeezed to long-on
fuller again outside off, mishit back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Malik employs the latest of late cuts and places it between backward point and short third man
banged in short and outside off, sits up. Malik has ample time to swivel-pull this to deep midwicket
low full toss on off, whipped through midwicket
slower cutter outside off, dabbed in front of mid-on for a quick single
back of a length and on off, pushed back to the bowler
low full toss on middle, flicked to the right of midwicket. Smart diving save
Haris steps away outside leg, Panyangara bangs it short and outside off. Mistimed back to the bowler
low full toss on the leg stump, biffed to long-on
slippery bounce outside off, Malik loads up for a pull and manages a top edge fine on the leg side. First ODI fifty for Malik since September 2009..
length on off and middle, slugged away with some power past midwicket
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped to square leg, straight to the fielder
fuller length and on off, whipped away towards deep midwicket
he takes toll of this. Sprayed on the pads, flicked away to the right of short fine leg. Easy pickings
good length and on off, Haris gets forward and pushes it to mid-off
he aims for a yorker, pushes it too full. Glanced to fine leg
full toss angling away. Malik, who was making room, reaches out and slices it to the off-side sweeper

both men moved away from their normal positions - Panyangara bowls from wide of the crease and Malik leaps away to the leg side to try a drill through the covers. Good ball this, quick and speared in at leg stump. Gets an outside edge to third man
makes room again, and this time he sends the low full toss past mid-off's left. Concentrated only on timing, and reaped good reward
into the block hole on middle and leg, Malik has made room again and digs it out to point. Should have been stopped, but a fumble allows the single
seems a slower ball gone wrong, ends up a loopy full toss outside off which is sliced to point
appears he finds the yorker more comfortable to bowl than the slower ball. Looks for the back-of-the-hand variation and it ends up a huge full toss outside off. Pulled wide of long-on
flicked off his pads through square leg
low full toss on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, nudged to deep midwicket
terrific batting. Malik has been there long enough, looks quite comfortable manipulating the crease as he walks away to get beside the ball and lifts it over the covers. Spotted the gap and nailed it
gets down the track as he moves back around the wicket, driven into the covers
fired in on middle, but it's short. Allows the batsman to jump back and pull to long-on's right. Masakadza manages to keep it to two
spotted the batsman charging as he goes wide of the crease and round-arms it in on middle. Pushed back down the ground
flighted outside off, worked away to deep midwicket
full on the legs, Haris is content to rotate strike as he flicks through to deep midwcket
full toss on leg stump, should have sent that packing, but Malik misses his timing. Gets a thick bottom edge and the ball rolls off his pads into the off side
fullish and a shade outside off, Haris can only punch it down the ground for a single. Can't get under it, nor did he had room to slog it

gains a lot of height! Raza at long-on races to his right, his neck craned up. But he's not quick enough. Nor can he keep it inside the field. The bat turned in his hand as he went after the fuller ball on middle and off. Mistimes the slog, but it doesn't matter
there's the 300, and it's a length ball that's disappered. Muscled over square leg with a grand swing of the arms
short third man gets a good hand to this. Stops the boundary that Malik was looking for as he guided the full toss outside off with the open face
width on offer outside off. Malik steps away outside off and slashes it towards sweeper cover. The fielder fumbles but just a single
very full and outside off, squeezed past the covers for one
low full toss on off, dragged to the leg side off the inner part of the bat
another low full toss outside off, which is driven solidly to deep cover. Sweeper moves to his left and hunts it down
dropped shortish and outside off, whipped away towards long-on. Time for Haris to raise his bat.. Fourth fifty of Pakistan innings
low full toss outside off, scythed away to backward point, where Raza flings to his left and intercepts the ball. Top, top save
lowish full toss outside off, slapped to sweeper cover after making some room
right in the blockhole outside off, he backs away and jabs it to the covers
yorker just outside off. Haris can only squeeze it back to the bowler
Panyangara does not nail the yorker now, offers length on the leg stump. Haris makes room and takes the aerial route, lofting it to the right of mid-off
change-up and that's dispatched! Banged in shortish and on the leg stump, he smashes a pull over deep midwicket. Right off the meat of the bat
hits the gap again! Haris reaps reward for intent again. He steps down the track, manufactures a full toss and whips it, splitting deep midwicket and long-on. Ruins what started as a tight over..
fired full on middle, Malik drills a drive down to mid-off, who is in the circle
right in the blockhole at the base of off, squeezed down to mid-off
and he misses the yorker now! Dishes out a length ball, Haris makes room outside leg and mauls a six over cow corner

Haris steps away outside leg again, Vitori wants to follow him with a yorker. Ends up bowling a low full toss, which is spliced away in front of square on the leg side. Below the waistline say the umpires. Not a no ball

Haris makes room again, Vitori lasers a yorker now. Dug out to the leg side through mid-on. They take two by the time the bowler runs back from his followthrough and collects the ball. The throw was awry as well
speared in on the pads, not quite a yorker. Haris can't connect with the flick. They sneak in a leg bye
wide full toss, Haris reaches out and slices it to the left of backward point. Could have hit that better, for that was a freebie
low full toss outside off, dips in late. Malik loads up and pushes it back to the bowler without much power
yorker outside off, drilled down the ground. The bowler dives to his left in his followthrough makes a half-save
low full toss outside off, driven crisply past the covers. Sweeper runs across but fumbles, giving away two

slower ball.. Fuller and outside off, he throws his bat at it (literally). It flies over the stumps at strikers'. The ball is sliced up in the air to the left of the man at the covers. Evades Chigu I guess
full toss on off, clubbed away to deep midwicket
very full and outside off, driven to mid-off
Haris makes room outside leg, the bowler chases him. Clipped through midwicket
Haris shows his ace up early, backs away again. Vitori hammers a yorker. Dug out to off
skied and it bounces in front of an on-rushing long-on. Fuller length ball on middle, Malik swings hard, mishits into no-man's land..
too full and on off, Malik holds his balance and lifts it in the gap between mid-off and covers after stepping away outside leg
mighty full and on the stumps, Malik makes room again. Drills this to mid-off for one. The fielder flings to his left and makes a good stop
yorker outside off as makes room. Malik uses every inch of his reach and slaps it to sweeper cover. And there it is, highest total at the Gaddafi..
what a comeback! Century for Malik... He performs the sajda Slower, lowish full toss on off, Malik walks across the stumps and nudges it to the leg side for three. The Gaddafi roars
lands in front of long-off. Slower length ball outside off, he mishits the lofted strike in front of the man in the deep
pitched up and outside off, Malik gets under it and lofts it over the man at mid-off
slower lifter outside off, Malik is early into the swipe and fails to connect. He nearly fell over

sloppy fielding and four! Length and outside off, might have been slower in pace. Mailk winds up, loads up and slogs it away towards long-on. One bounce and the fielder lets it slip away to the boundary
near yorker on off, jabbed down to long-off
wide yorker, jammed out to point after reaching out
right in the blockhole outside off, he steps away and squeezes it to the covers
dropped by Hami Masakadza at backward point. Low full toss outside off, carved to the right of the fielder, who spills it
mighty full on middle, he clears his front leg and drills it to long-off

a consolatory wicket for Zimbabwe off the last ball. The umpire check if that's a legal ball. Yes, it is all okay. Malik out for 112 off 76 balls. Another low full toss, sliced away to the left of backward point. Hamilton makes no mistake here.

inn2.comm: back of a length on off stump, capably defended
tests Sibanda in the corridor and he's up for the test. Shoulders arms as the shortish delivery sails into the keeper's gloves. Great carry
fullish on middle, turned between midwicket and mid-on to get off the mark
defends a back of a length ball solidly
has seen the pitch offer him decent bounce and goes to dig on into its middle. Raza ducks
gets some curve now. Reward for probing the fuller length. Catches the batsman in a squared up position as Raza blocks
beautifully driven through the covers. Anwar searches for swing, not the worst thing to do with a new ball, but Sibanda leans forward and trusts his timing
pulls his length back and Sibanda blocks to point
that's helpful. Went on the pull, but the shortish delivery skids onto him. Inside edge taken, beats the stumps and scurries away to the long leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, dabbed towards point
opts for a straighter bat, but the same result. His legs were taking him away from the line of the ball and offered enough gap between bat and pad. Inisde edge take, long leg boundary found.
prefers to stay on the shorter side, this time Sibanda is forced off his feet as he gets on top of the bounce and blocks on off stump
he's getting the ball to nip around! Hits a good length then gets the ball to straighten past the outside edge. Raza's poke is no match
angles this back of a length delivery in at Raza, pushed into the covers
pins him to his crease with a shortish ball on off stump, blocked into the covers. Good energy in the field so far from Pakistan
plays a touch away from the body as the awayswinger from Sami takes an outside edge to third man. Raza looked for point judging by the open face
gets forward to block a good length ball and seeks a quick single. But second slip rushes forward to stop any such thing
presses forward to block beneath his eyes. No single with the off-side ring prowling around
a shade short and Raza goes for a pull. It's the inside edge that rears its head again as the ball drifts away to the left of long leg
hands on heads time for Anwar as he bowls a good length ball that moves back in and keeps, perhaps, a bit low. Defended
punches a back of a length delivery outside off to cover. Pakistan are doing quite well in stopping these singles. Then again, Zimbabwe's bowlers were just as good in the early bits
nudged through midwicket. Easy two considering the man was on the boundary and mid-on had to pitch in
seems the offcutter from Anwar. Raza lets it come on and slides it off the open face to point
lovely shot, and matched by the effort at point. Malik throws himself to his right to cut a well-timed back-foot push from Raza
picks the gap between point and cover. Gets forward and meets the fuller ball with a solid push. That should help his early nerves
full and speared in on middle, Raza nearly closed his bat too early. Tells himself to use the full face at the final moment and blocks
stands tall beside this shortish delivery on off stump and slices it to third man

back of a length and outside off, Sibanda dabs it behind point. Sets off and is nearly halfway down when he realises his partner was a little sluggish. Yasir, at point, had threatened the ball. But he couldn't have denied them the run
shortish on middle, he's up off his feet to tuck the ball to long leg
fullish on middle, tapped to mid-on
full on middle, kept out

leaps past the outside edge! There is still some movement off the seam on offer and Anwar coaxes it to work his way. Pitches it on a good length to bring the batsman just half forward and then makes him nearly pay for his indecision
probes the fuller length again, if a bit outside off to try and tempt Sibanda. No shot offered
good thing he isn't following the ball. Dragged his bat back behind his pad the second he felt the good length ball straightening away from him. Lovely bowling
a little shorter in length and Sibanda is far more comfortable with the punch off the back foot. Can't get the gap in the covers though
slid off the half a bat he offers to the back of a length delivery outside off. Third man ahoy!
shortish and outside off, pokes and misses.
drags his line a little further outside off to see if the Zimbabwe batsmen are nervous enough to chase it. Sibanda isn't
back of a length and outside off, eased to deep third man
good length ball on off stump, with the faintest trace of away swing, defended with the open face

picked up! Check the hang time on that! It was a tad short and Raza was perfectly poised - batting deep in his crease, his weight on the back foot and a high backlift, all he had to do was swing. And boy, did he. Six over midwicket
short again, Raza gets up and whips his body around as he plays a pull. Only a single to deep square leg
seemed the scrambled seam delivery, outside off. Raza goes for a punch to point
sizes up a fuller ball outside off, had half a mind to play at it, but then decides to say no thank you. Leaves the slower ball well enough alone
full on middle, Raza finds the long-on boundary. Again he's concentrating on keeping the bat straight because of his hard bottom handed grip

just wide of the lone slip! He charges Anwar this time and looks for a lash over extra cover. It was there for it, to be honest. Perhaps Raza's own efforts to make room went against him. Goes off the bottom of the bat
fuller delivery on middle, turned away into the vacant region to the right of mid-on
keeps it full and outside off, Sibanda leans forward and runs the ball to point. That's part one. Then he gets his skates on and ensures the quick single
rushes the batsman straight away. It's a shortish length tucking him up. Sibanda looks for a glance, but he can't connect
uses Wahab's pace to his advantage this time as he guides a shortish delivery to deep third man
has Raza jumping up against a short ball on middle. But the batsman's done well, using soft hands to dab the ball in front and to the right of the bowler
beats him on the angle! And Wahab's usual extra bounce does the rest. Hits a good length, draws the batsman to play. But the ball soars past the outside edge
does better this time because the length is shorter, and gives him a touch more time to get himself ready for the glide to third man
goes for a pull despite the ball not being as short, inside edge finds its way to deep square leg
third man's been busy this innings. So have these opening batsman, bring up the fifty partnership with half a bat
fullish on middle and off, turned towards midwicket

the scrambled seam delivery finds him camping on his back foot, a symptom of his indecision. So is the outside edge. Should really have been stopped at the third man boundary, but Wahab's slide is poor

soft! Too shot as he whips a harmless delivery on the pads into the hands of midwicket. Good overhead catch from Hafeez. Raza can't believe it. Pakistan have their first strike, in addition to a scarily mounting run rate
full on off stump, the hulking figure of Hamilton gets down low to block
fullish on off stump, Hami strides forward to block
not enough room for that slice to point. Wahab's shortish length skirts past Sibanda, and I daresay it's beaten him for pace
another pacy short ball that strikes Sibanda before he gets ready for it. Goes for a pull, ball hits bat more than anything. Secures a single towards midwicket
good length ball outside off, blocked
back of a length on middle, tucked into the midwicket region
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms rather emphatically
keeps it short on middle and leg, but Hami is able to pull and control it rather nicely for a single to deep square leg
gentle medium pace, and a bit outside off. Run down to third man.
started well, but this good length ball has drifted a bit too far down leg
good length ball back trying to befriend off stump, Sibanda plays party pooper
smart stroke as he comes down the track to a good length ball. But he doesn't capitalise thereafter. Hits it straight at cover
full on middle, defended
seems the offcutter outside off, gets forward and pushes to point. Sibanda's absorbing a lot of dot balls here
slashed past point's left. Helped a bit by his trip down the track and secures a couple of runs to deep third man
brings down the full face of the bat to reply to a shortish ball on off stump

his role is to be the enforcer and he's got it down pat. Has Masakadza in an awful position, crouched with the body falling over and his gloves leading towards the line of the short ball. Single gives him refuge at the non-strikers' end
good length ball on off stump, the change-up surprises Sibanda. Plays all around it and is struck on the pads. Could have drifted past off stump

Wahab is stunned, he's celebrated instantly and then looks around to see umpire Tiffin shaking his head. Good short ball outside off is met by a pull shot and Hami M's intention to drag the ball into the leg side hurts him. Thick nick carries through to the keeper. But it doesn't go down in the books
back of a length and outside off, slid down behind point

consolation! Hurries the batsman with another bouncer, targeting the batsman's back shoulder. Sibanda goes for a hook, but is terribly late on it. The ball pops off the splice and lands in Wahab's own hands, after he had to abandon his followthrough and run back a few steps
good length ball a bit outside off, defended
pushed to mid-on off one of the fuller length

high says the ump, but that looks quite close to an lbw! Only hit the knee-roll and he was barely forward. Neat little delivery that cuts back in late. Fools the defence of the batsman. To my eyes that was terribly terribly close
medium pacer can't bowl that length. It's short and Hami M has pulled off the front foot and hit miles in front of square

goes for a scoop over fine leg, having plated his front foot almost outside off. Struck on the front pad as he was doing so. Half an appeal from Hammad, but this was hitting the top flap. Can't be given. Meanwhile, a single's been taken
teases the outside edge, and then beats it. Back of a length and pushed across the right-hander
good length ball on middle and off, defended
sitting on the back foot - possibly because of Wahab's staple length - and it's short again. Pulled to midwicket
dug in again, but it's off target. Straying down leg and he helps it away to long leg
lovely one to start. Gets it to lift right over the top of middle and off. Chiggy watched it quite carefully though and swayed away
the two-card trick nearly works! Having forced him back, Wahab bowls one across the right hander. Chiggy's late in his shot and gets an inside edge that nearly topples leg stump
good length and outside off, pushed to short cover
gets the ball to nibble enough to have Chiggy sporting a wry smile after an uncertain block. Some late movement away off the pitch
shortish this time and it's been pulled behind square leg
full on middle and leg, Hami M turns it to short midwicket
width offered and Hami M taps it on top of the bounce to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, Hami M uses his bottom hand to work it to long-on
starts with a shorter length though and allows the batsman to keep back and push down the ground
flighted but it's slipping towards leg, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, Hami M presents a full face to cover
tossed up on middle, pushed along the ground to long-on
bowls a bit quicker and flatter, Chiggy is a shade late with his flick and has to settle for a leg bye into the leg side
flatter delivery tennis fore-armed past his right and to the two men patrolling the straight boundary
takes a fuller ball from off stump and finds a couple of runs behind square on the leg side. That's better, some urgency from Zimbabwe
fuller delivery outside off, blocked
advances on the bowler and slaps a length ball away to deep point
gets the offcutter going outside off, Chiggy's drive though is not quite lucky
waits on a shortish delivery on off stump to slice behind point. Can't pick the gap
fuller delivery outside off, Chiggy drills it through the covers

steps down the track, but has misread the wrong 'un. It keeps coming in at him as he looks for a cover drive. Gets an inside edge onto the pads and the ball  drops by his feet. Has to rush back to make his ground with the alert Sarfraz
over the top! Likes the tossed up delivery outside off and launches it over the covers
hangs back knowing the length will be adjusted and dabs it past point
another flatter delivery outside off, cut behind point
turn for Yasir, but with his trajectory behind quite flat the batsman has time to play it off the pitch, pushed through the covers
there's punishment. No spin there, could have been the googly too. If it was, Hami M saw it early, rocked back and pulled over midwicket
enough width for Chiggy to slash outside off, but he's not timed it. Single to deep point
a shade shortish and outside off, dabbed to deep third man
nice and tight on middle, Chiggy doesn't want to make the pace himself as he blocks
length ball outside off, asking to be smashed over the top. The batsman had the same intentions, but went a bit too hard at it. Inside edge deflects off his boot
slower ball, short ball, slapped through point. Zimbabwe are going a bit too serenely, but then again the latest trend in ODIs is to keep your wickets intact
full but it's on the pads this time, Hammad has strayed from the discipline he'd shown early. Flicked away almost to the midwicket boundary. The fielder there doesn't let it pass
flighted outside off, Hami M steps forward to drive down the ground
flighted outside off, Chiggy leans into a lovely drive through extra cover
drilled through the covers as Yasir returns to tossing the ball up again
this one is quite quick though. Flat and short to boot. Easy enough for the batsman to rock back and whip through straight midwicket
invites the batsman to drive, and so he does. Single to the sweeper
that's the one he's looking for! Fast, flat and aimed at the stumps. The batsman had been deceived into playing a cut and just about manages an inside edge. Quite lucky there
starts off with a short of a length delivery that's pushed down to long-on
slower through the air as he tosses the ball up on middle and off, Hami has got down on one knee and shovels the ball to long leg. Appeal from Hafeez, but he'd got bat to it
flighted outside off, brings the batsman forward with a drive to long-on
down the track, almost to the pitch of a fuller on middle, pushed to long-on again
good length ball on middle and leg, defended
flighted outside off, pushed to long-on
flighted and outside off, driven to the covers
darted flatter and on off, he sets up for a pull and flat-bats it back to the bowler, who leaps and makes a half-stop
looped up full around off, drilled past the covers. Sweeper tidies up in the deep
slid through quicker and spins, might have been the googly. Squirted to leg
flatter and on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
legbreak outside off, Chigumbura rocks back in search of a cut. Chops it towards backward point for one
flat and fired on off, jabbed to mid-on
Hafeez gives this ample air outside off, Chigumbura seeks to flick and gets an outer edge through vacant slip cordon
pitched up and outside off, driven to the covers
fuller and on middle and leg, swept away behind square on the leg side
slid down leg, wide called
Hafeez drifts another one down leg, helped away past a diving short fine leg with a sweep
quicker and stump-to-stump line, driven down to long-on for a single
flat and on off, squeezed back to Yasir
lobbed up on off, milked down to long-on
mighty full and pushed outside off, he jams out a drive to the covers
legbreak outside off, eased away to sweeper cover
flatter and on middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
length ball darted on off, Chigumbura camps back and punches it to the covers
offbreak on off, pushed back to Hafeez
straighter ball outside off, he plays for the turn as the ball zips past the outside edge
flat and quicker through the air, punched down to long-on
fuller and on off, Masakadza eases forward and drives it to long-on
spins in on middle, he backs away and chops it to point
drifting onto the leg stump, swept straight to short fine leg. Chigumbura would be kicking himself for not putting that away
pushed back to Yasir, who dives and intercepts the ball
tossed up generously outside off, he hunts for an expansive drive and manages an inside edge onto the pads
back of a length and turning away, slapped to backward point
helped down to mid-on
fuller and outside off, driven to the left of Yasir to long-off
flatter and on off, forced down to long-on
flighted on off stump, Hami keeps back and turns it to midwicket
finds his fifty with a miscue to long-off. Had been looking for a swipe down the ground but he hadn't got to the pitch and was worried about hitting in the air
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
flighted outside off, defended
flatter delivery on middle, whipped to long leg
the situation demands some risk and Hami provides it with a reverse sweep. Picks up a flighted ball on and around middle and powers it away past short third man and point
a warm up delivery if ever there was one. Short and wide outside off, Chiggy has lashed it over point. Strong man, strong shot
shortish and outside off, slid away to the third man boundary. Sami's erring by providing room and Chiggy shows off his skills. Keeps it along the ground this time
overcorrects and offers a half-volley on off stump. Drilled past the mid-off fielder's left. Good shot
good length on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
good length ball on middle and leg, looks to turn it away past short fine leg. But the fielder pulls out a good dive to his right
back of a length and outside off, dabbed to deep third man
lots of intent in his step down the track, but Hafeez pulls the length back and keeps the batsman to a flick through midwicket
raises the hundred stand, which brings a smattering of applause from the dressing room. Flick through the leg side again
searching for a couple, but the fielder runs in quick enough from deep midwicket to keep the batsmen honest
good footwork turns a flighted delivery into a full toss, but Hami's thump down the ground is stopped by Hafeez.
slower through the air, and Hami M's into the flick a bit too early. Short midwicket reaches out with his right hand, but it's lobbed him
flighted outside off stump, Hami M defends
pulls out the reverse sweep to a loopy delivery on middle and off, doesn't connect with the ball dipping and hitting his boot. Leg bye to short third man
eased through the covers as he steps forward to a flighted delivery outside off
gets down the track to drive a good length ball to long-on

falls short of the fielder rushing in from cover. The angle from around the wicket tempts Chiggy to cose the face too early. Gets the leading edge and it hangs in the air so long, or rather not long enough
glanced to long leg as Malik strays on the pads
shorter delivery allows the batsman to hang deep in his crease and punch to long-on. Brings up his own fifty
healthy strike! I think he took a bit of pride in that shot. Skipped down the track and just calmly lifted the ball over the midwicket boundary. Clean swing of the arms
sized up the flatter trajectory early and sweeps to deep square leg
pushed through on middle and leg, Chiggy goes for a whip across the line and can't connect
goes back and punches a flat, good length ball on leg stump. Hafeez is on hand to stop it

dropped by Shafiq. Hafeez keeps spearing the ball flat, Chiggy decided to do something about it and went for a front-foot pick up over midwicket. Didn't get the elevation but got enough power for the ball to burst through the fielder's hands

another one that falls short of the fielder! Hammad races in from deep midwicket, tracking a biff from Chiggy. Deserved a lot more than that considering it was a full toss, but it hit the bottom of the bat
slugged away to deep backward square leg. This had a bit more flight, and was a lot slower
that's how a full toss should be treated. Got it a bit high on the bat as he went down low for the slog sweep. But he's hit it hard enough to clear the ropes
flighted outside off, blocked off the front foot

down the throat of Hammad at deep midwicket! Zimbabwe had decided to switch gears. Hami's already got a six in the over, but goes down the track again.  Pulls out the flick and struck it well. But there is protection down there. The fielder ran in, then slid and holds a good, low catch
goes back and flicks a length ball off his pads.
flicked to deep square leg as Hafeez bowls flat and full
flighted on off stump, blocked
steps down to try and make his play, but he can't get to the pitch and he doesn't have any room to muscle it away. has to settle for tapping it back to the bowler
pushed through on middle and goes on with the arm. Williams is unable to flick it and the ball is lodged between his knees
driven down to long-on
fuller delivery on middle and leg, turned to short fine leg
shuffles down the track and gets perhaps a bit too close to the ball for his comfort. Can't get the leverage he wanted behind the drive and it goes along the ground to long-on
good length ball on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
shot! Found the short ball, likes the angle of the ball going across him, makes his own room just to ensure he can thump it through extra cover
flighted outside off, Williams plays a chip down the ground to long-on
brings up the team's 200 with a calm little clip through midwicket. Required run-rate inching towards 12 though, with 15 overs left
flighted outside off, Chiggy drives well and hopes to beat mid-off. But Malik gets across to his right and dives to keep it to single
down the track for a whip to the left of long-on
tossed up on off stump, pushed to mid-off
muscled to deep midwicket. Chiggy advances on the spinner, who doesn't offer him much room. Heaved away but can't hit an unmanned spot
shortish and outside off, cut away towards point
length ball on middle and leg, Williams has swatted it away over deep square leg. Lots of power behind that shot
shortish on middle and leg, tucked away square on the leg side
weaved away from a short ball barely outside off stump and ramps it to deep third man. Clever stroke, especially considering the bowler's length and pace
short, fast, accurate. Too good for Chiggy. Went for a hook, but there's ample daylight as the ball carries through about head high
banged in short, connects with the pull this time. But he hasn't got enough power behind it. Deep square leg is there. He's waiting. It should be a dolly. And Hammad Azam drops it
slower ball, on a fuller length, cracked away through point
was that a slower bouncer? Yep. Had the tennis ball bounce as it looped over the disinterested batsman
starts with the  slower ball, but it's short and sits up for Williams to pull behind square leg. Placed extremely well. That's what took Pakistan to this massive total
another short delivery, but this gets onto Williams too quickly to do much with the pull. The ball wanders towards midwicket and the lack of timing actually gives him a single
looks like short is the plan. This is the change of pace though and Chiggy has to adjust while playing the pull. Gets an inside edge deflects off his body but doesn't carry to the keeper
full on off stump, pushed down the ground.
well, they all matter. WIlliams manages to pull a short ball outside off over third man. Happy outside edge
A Wahab short ball, an awkward pull, cue the top edge and a single to deep third man
shortish on middle and leg, pulled behind square leg
picked up the slower short ball, jumped away towards the leg side to slash the ball over point. Noughty little innings here from Chiggy
pings him on the grille! Wahab noticed the batsman straying away to leg again and bowls a quick bouncer at the body. Takes evasive action as much as he goes for the pull and is struck
back of a length delivery that lifts off this hard deck and beats Chiggy's swat
moves around the wicket and delivers a length ball, Chiggy hasn't been put off by the short ball barrage. Backs away and lashes it through extra cover
full and outside off, laced through the covers
fullish on off stump, Williams almost runs with his push to mid-off

plants that back foot across outside off, Anwar panicks into a slower short ball almost. Could have worked for the batsman, but he doesn't timed the pull well enough. Two taken between midwicket and long-on
cramps him up with a back of a length delivery that follows him outside leg. Struck below his stomach before he can get across to the other end
full on off stump, Williams stays back and beside the ball to slice to point. Had been looking to thread that gap
full on leg stump, whipped to midwicket
tossed up and angled in on leg stump, Williams has a big stride forward before he bends low and sweeps to the square leg boundary. Top shot
gets down the track, had made room to open up the cover field as well. But Malik fired it in and cramped him for room. Only gets an inside edge
stays beside the fuller ball and drills it to long-off
pushed through on leg stump, Chiggy goes for a sweep but can't connect
gives this a lot more air, and the batsman sees an opportunity. Gets down the track, but his drive down the ground doens't beat the bowler
so he takes all the fielders out of the equation! Cleared his front leg and belted the tossed up delivery on off stump miles into the stands behind the sightscreen

beautiful yorker on middle. Didn't deserve the result. Williams had to bring his bat down to protect his stumps, but it came down at an angle and took the outside edge. Beats short third man comfortably
the old slower ball bouncer loops over WIlliams and slides down leg
trusts in change of pace again, followed the batsman's movement outside leg with the offcutter. Slapped to mid-off
neatly bowled slower bouncer, and although Chiggy waited for it to slash over point, he is beaten. Nearly topples over in disappointment.
normal paced short ball, and Chiggy directs it into the vacant midwicket region for a single
offcutter on the pads, swiped to square leg
he hadn't been on the boundary, Hafeez. Had to backtrack as this short ball is slammed hard and flat. Beats him to his right as well and falls only inches short of the rope

goes straight up and Sarfraz pouches it safely. The Wahab short ball has held sway in Lahore. Williams had been on the front foot, and although he had the room to free his arms, it came at him too quickly. Top edge results and he's gone
outside edge, but Wahab's pace and bounce means the ball soars over the keeper's right hand. He did try to angle his bat so it might have been intentional. But it went a lot finer than he wanted
tapped towards mid-off
slower short ball on off stump, guided to deep third man
phew! Is that why he's been pushed up? Stood up tall against a shortish delivery outside off and slapped it to the left of deep point. Great connection
gets up on his toes to negotiate another one banged into the middle of the deck

raises his arms in triumph after sending a rank long hop over the deep third man boundary! Maiden ODI century for the Zimbabwe captain. Decent innings, but he would've liked for it to have had a better impact on the game
slower short ball this time and Chiggy isn't able to get the slash working quite as well
pulls all the pace off another bouncer, right over middle this time, looks for a ramp. No luck
bye-bye ball! It was length and it sat up for the pummel over long-on. Good striker of the ball, Chigumbura. Forces the captain to go and set his bowler right
yorker becomes an overpitched ball on middle and leg, Chiggy makes room and drills the ball down the ground. Solid strike
Phew! Third one of the over, and it's been timed as well as any. Another poor short ball, lacking in menace. The batsman sate back in his crease and pulls mightily
back of a length on middle and leg, goes off the pad into the square leg region, I think
probes the angle across the right-hander, Mutumbami looks to lift it on its way to the third man boundary but can't put bat to ball
back of a length on off stump, slid to point and has to heed Chiggy's call for a quick single
full, straight, off stump knocked over. Chiggy'd backed away to try and get under the short ball, but it's the opposite that arrives and he's late in getting his bat down
beats him on the angle across the right-hander. Dab to third man comes too late from Utseya
takes the shoulder of the bat and beats the wide slip that had been placed for the lower-order batsman. Squared him up with a little jag away off the deck
gets a little help as this back of a length delivery gains a bit more bounce and thuds into the batsman's glove as he looks to fend it away
short ball, doesn't have much behind it, Utseya has swiveled on his back foot and pulls to the long leg boundary
hits the yorker on middle and leg, Utseya manages to dig it out to midwicket
length ball outside off, slogged and mistimed to mid-on
add that to the best shots in the match. On the other side, tick the Sami overpitched counter by one as well. Mutumbami leans into an extra cover drive that just skims away
keeps it full, has a little width as well. Mutumbami is quick on the drive again but finds cover
back of a length delivery outside off, Utseya goes for a drive and misses
shortish on middle and leg, nudged away to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, slapped into the covers

moves around the wicket and delivers a high full toss - Mutumbami goes for a push through the off side and gets a thick outside edge. Should have only been a single as Sami settles on his knees to get his body behind the ball.... and yet dribbles past and into the boundary
low full toss on off stump, drilled to mid-off
oof, that's a full toss which wanders well past the batsman's right. The ball must have slipped out of his hands. Cue the towels
moves back over the wicket and finishes with a bouncer on leg stump. Could have been called another wide, but umpire Tiffin's happy with it
fuller, perhaps slower as well, and well wide of off stump. Utseya somehow manages to connect and find a single through the covers
chipped to long-off as he leans on a fuller ball outside off
beats him with the  slower ball and Utseya's intention to knock the stuffing out of it goes amiss
full on middle and leg, nearly a yorker. Turned away towards midwicket
goes short, and slow. Pulled away to deep midwicket, who fumbles a bit and gives a second run
low full toss outside off has been powered away to long-on, lots of bottom hand there
shortish and outside off, slid away to deep third man
half a top edge, more glove on a pull that lobs the keeper and finds its way to the long leg boundary
full on off stump, Utseya opens the face to point. No run there
a slog having gone down the track. Gets an inside edge to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, dabbed to point
slower delivery slips down the leg side. No interest from the batsman
finishes with a bouncer that soars over middle and the swaying batsman
finds a boundary first ball. Plants an open face down on the full, slower ball outside off and picks the gap behind point
hits the yorker on middle, Utseya can only keep it out
good length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers
slower ball outside off, Mutumbami has threaded the needle between short third man and point. Brings up Zimbabwe's highest total against a Test-nation in ODIs
nails the blockhole on middle, pushed to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, eased through extra cover for a couple. And that is that.
